title: Jack Gargan (hurler)
text:
John Gargan (8 November 1918 – 1991) was an <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> <a href="hurling">hurler</a> who played as a left wing-forward for the <a href="Kilkenny%20GAA">Kilkenny</a> and <a href="Dublin%20GAA">Dublin</a> senior teams.
Gargan made his first appearance for the Kilkenny team during the <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship%201939">1939 championship</a> and was a regular on the inter-county scene until his retirement from Dublin after the <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship%201947">1947 championship</a>. During that time he won one <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal and four <a href="Leinster%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">Leinster</a> medals.
At club level Gargan enjoyed successful spells with <a href="%C3%89ire%20%C3%93g%20GAA%20%28Kilkenny%29">Éire Óg</a> and <a href="Faughs%20GAA">Faughs</a>.
Gargan's father, <a href="Matt%20Gargan">Matt</a>, won six All-Ireland medals with Kilkenny between 1907 and 1913, while his nephew, <a href="Frank%20Cogan">Frank Cogan</a>, won an <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal in <a href="Gaelic%20football">football</a> with <a href="Cork%20GAA">Cork</a> in 1973.
